title: The NFL's All-Under-Pressure Team: 15 people with something huge on the line in 2025
content: Let's run through the people in the NFL who have the most to gain or lose this season, in terms of new contracts or new jobs.

title: Pro wrestling legend Hulk Hogan dies at age 71
content: Hulk Hogan, an icon in the world of professional wrestling, has died at the age of 71, Florida police and WWE said Thursday.

title: Kansas' Self hospitalized, has 2 stents inserted
content: Kansas coach Bill Self was hospitalized Thursday after experiencing "some concerning symptoms" and had two stents inserted. The school said he was expected to make a full recovery.

title: Raiders releasing Wilkins; NFLPA files grievance
content: The Raiders have informed defensive tackle Christian Wilkins that he has been released. The NFLPA has filed a grievance on his behalf after the $35.2M of guaranteed money left on his contract was voided last month.

title: Mariners land slugging 1B Naylor from D-backs
content: The Mariners bolstered their efforts to return to the playoffs by acquiring slugger Josh Naylor from the Diamondbacks on Thursday night.

title: Rodgers opens with pick: Got it out of the way
content: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said his interception wasn't a bad omen for his Steelers tenure, saying, "I'm going to throw some touchdowns, too," and expressing optimism about the team's Super Bowl hopes.

title: Trump issues executive order for college sports
content: President Donald Trump has directed members of his Cabinet to develop a plan in the next 30 days aimed at preserving college sports opportunities and preventing college athletes from becoming professionals.

title: Hurricanes lock in Blake with 8-year, $45M deal
content: Jackson Blake, coming off a rookie season in which he had 17 goals and 17 assists, signed an eight-year, $45 million contract extension with the Hurricanes.

title: Iamaleava: Left Tennessee to come back home
content: UCLA quarterback Nico Iamaleava said Thursday that his main motivation for transferring this spring was proximity to family, not the money in his NIL deal.

title: 🔮 Latest fantasy football mock draft
content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal? Best pick?
content: ESPN's Jeremy Woo polled executives and scouts on the incoming rookie class. Who will win ROY? Which players will surpass expectations?

title: 'Pay Us What You Owe Us': Inside the WNBPA's statement-making All-Star Weekend
content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

title: McGee's Mascot Power Rankings: The best of the fun and furry in college football
content: From giant red blobs and 1,700-pound steer to coonskin caps and bears riding Harleys, these are the sport's top merrymakers.

content: From his "whys" to his "life license plate," Schottenheimer explains his ink and what he'll do if he wins a Super Bowl.

content: Which offseason acquisitions and draft picks will have the most impact at their new destinations in Year 1?

title: MLB Power Rankings: A red-hot NL team surges up to debut at No. 1
content: Our first list of the second half sees a massive shake-up in the top five, with three clubs at their highest rankings of the seasons -- including a new squad at the top.

title: Pete Rose history on display at Baseball Hall of Fame
content: The National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum's archives contain dozens of items related to MLB's hits king.

title: In the wake of tragedy, can Liverpool win a second straight Premier League title?
content: Diogo Jota's death casts an immense shadow over Liverpool's preseason preparations, but new arrivals have strengthened the squad. Could the Reds win the Premier League title again?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea join Liverpool in Isak pursuit
content: Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak is open to leaving this summer, with Liverpool and Chelsea keen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Greene to join exclusive club? Luzardo turns it around? Don't be surprised
content: Let's take a look into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: "If he failed, their process failed": Inside the NFLPA meltdown
content: Players are looking to learn from the mistakes that led them to hire ex-NFLPA executive director Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: Chiefs' Travis Kelce shows out in training camp ahead of 'Happy Gilmore 2' cameo
content: The Kansas City Chiefs tight end had an impressive Day 2 of training camp before his "Happy Gilmore 2" appearance premieres.

title: No Messi, no Alba: Can the MLS All-Star Game be fixed, and where does it go from here?
content: With some of the league's biggest stars absent, MLS must find a way to boost the profile of the All-Star Game.

title: England's savior Agyemang embracing super-sub role, but what's next for her?
content: Michelle Agyemang's breakout Euro 2025 has helped England reach the final, but what lessons can she learn from teammates and Spain's young talent?

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 9: Outlaws, Atlas stay on top
content: While the top three squads from last week's power rankings remain steady, the Whipsnakes have moved up to the No. 4 spot.

title: 2K details reveal roadmap for NBA 2K26
content: Here's the schedule for all upcoming reveals and announcements for the upcoming basketball simulation.

title: Karnataka CM urges Centre to supply urea as demand for fertiliser goes up with increase in area under crops
content: The Centre has allocated 11,17,000 tonnes of urea to Karnataka for kharif 2025, out of which 5,16,959 tonnes has been supplied, whereas the State’s requirement from April to July is 6,80,655 tonnes.

title: AAP says demolition notices issued to slum clusters in Shalimar Bagh, Shahdara, slams BJP
content: According to Ms. Atishi, residents of Indira Camp in Shalimar Bagh and Lalbagh in Shahdara — both established with allotment cards in 1990 — have been asked to vacate their homes within 15 days. Lalbagh slums are scheduled for demolition on July 31.

title: Gas leak from overturned LPG tanker triggers high alert on NH in Kerala’s Kanhangad
content: A special team, including gas company officials, fire force personnel and technical experts is overseeing the operation to safely transfer the gas to another tanker

title: ALTT, ULLU among over 20 OTT apps banned for obscene content
content: According to the government, the contents in question included sexual innuendos and in some cases long portions of sexually explicit scenes involving nudity thereby being pornographic in nature.

title: Supreme Court allows Kerala to withdraw plea against Governor, Centre resists
content: The Union Government said Kerala’s move is linked to the Tamil Nadu Governor case judgment of April 8

title: Nitish berates Opposition members for coming to Assembly dressed in black
content: Interestingly, quite a few MLAs of Mr. Kumar's JD(U) and his ally BJP had come to the House wearing helmets, claiming that they feared getting hit by the unruly Opposition members.

title: Karnataka government approves setting up residential schools for children of construction workers in 31 districts
content: Karnataka Building and Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Board to spend ₹1,125 crore on the project with each school costing between ₹34 crore and ₹38 crore

title: Depression to bring heavy rain in Odisha from July 25-28: IMD
content: The meteorological centre, Bhubaneswar, on July 25, 2025, issued a ‘red warning’ of extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places in Keonjhar and Mayurbhanj districts, and an ‘orange warning’ of very heavy rainfall in 10 other districts

title: Indian mission in Thailand issues travel advisory amidst ongoing unrest
content: The Thailand tourism authority said that “several attractions” in Ubon Ratchathani, Surin, Sisaket, Buriram, Sa Kaeo, Chanthaburi and Trat provinces are not recommended for visiting

title: Conspiracy to keep 'Bahujans' out of education, research: Rahul slams govt on vacant university posts
content: This is completely unacceptable. All vacant posts should be filled immediately, Bahujans should get their rights, not Manuwadi boycott, says T

title: Govindachamy’s prison escape raises serious questions about jail management, security in Kerala
content: Kerala Prisons and Correctional Services department suspends four jail officials on charges of grave security lapses, dereliction of duty and criminal negligence

title: Hyderabad | People without valid medical qualifications running unauthorised clinics for several years; TGMC initiates action
content: TGMC officials found medicines stored in open plastic containers and distributed by hand in an unsafe manner, with some reportedly being sold in nearby grocery shops

title: Supreme Court extends stay on summons to Rahul Gandhi in Savarkar case
content: The top court had stayed an Uttar Pradesh trial court summons issued to the Congress leader in an order in May while cautioning him from making “statements against our freedom fighters who gave us freedom”

title: Delhi HC seeks NIA's response on jailed MP Abdul Rashid's interim bail plea in terror funding case
content: A Bench of Justices Vivek Chaudhary and Shalinder Kaur issued notice to the NIA on the plea and listed the matter for further hearing on July 29

title: Telangana Deputy Bhatti makes a pitch for Cong, INDIA Bloc to raise OBC quota in Parliament
content: Mr. Bhatti, explained to the MPs that the entire process followed by the State Government and asserted that the survey was conducted in a meticulous and foolproof manner

title: India forms panel for COP-33 that it proposed to host
content: During his address at COP 28 in Dubai, Prime Minister Narendra Modi had proposed India as the host country for COP 33.

title: Parliament Monsoon session: Both Houses adjourned; Lok Sabha to take up discussion on Operation Sindoor on July 28
content: Four newly elected Rajya Sabha MPs from Tamil Nadu, including actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan, took oath as member of the House

title: Govindachamy’s prison break evokes echoes of ‘Ripper’ Jayanandan’s daring 2013 escape from Thiruvananthapuram jail
content: On July 11, 2013, ‘Ripper’ Jayanandan, a death row prisoner accused of eight murders for gain and 14 burglaries, made a daring midnight escape from the Central Prison, Thiruvananthapuram

title: Vice-President election: ECI appoints Rajya Sabha Secretary General as Returning Officer
content: By convention, the Secretary General, Lok Sabha or the Secretary General, Rajya Sabha is appointed as the Returning Officer, by rotation.

title: Opposition MPs tear and throw ‘SIR’ posters in bin as symbolic rejection of exercise
content: The MPs also staged a protest march in the Parliament House complex, demanding the rollback as well as a discussion on the issue in both houses

title: DRDO successfully tests UAV-launched Precision Guided Missile
content: DRDO has developed a UAV-Launched Missile – Extended Range (ULM-ER) munition designed for deployment via unmanned aerial platforms

title: Rajasthan school roof collapse LIVE: Seven students killed, locals say incident ‘happened due to negligence of administration’
content: Angry locals said they had informed the tehsildar and sub-divisional magistrate about the condition of the school building, but no action was taken.

title: Education Ministry permits seven new departments at Central University of Karnataka
content: The V-C said that CUK is establishing a Centre of Excellence in High Frequency Electronics in the campus, which aims at training manpower in high frequency electronics

title: Watch | Gujarat’s collapsing bridges: Cracks in infrastructure and accountability
content: Abhinay Deshpande reports on the tragedy in a State where at least six bridges have collapsed in the last four years

title: PM Modi now second longest serving in office in consecutive terms, surpasses Indira Gandhi’s record
content: Officials noted that Mr. Modi completes 4,078 days in office on Friday (July 25, 2025). Indira Gandhi was in the office in an unbroken stint for 4,077 days, from January 24, 1966 to March 24, 1977

title: Engineered for speed, not safety? The cost of Hyderabad’s ORR corridor
content: Hyderabad’s Outer Ring Road has seen over 30 deaths in 2025 and 369 in the past five years, with road safety analysts highlighting that most accidents are preventable errors like speeding, poor lane discipline, misuse of road shoulders, and inadequate driver training

title: PM Modi in Maldives LIVE: Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu welcomes PM Modi
content: PM Modi has been invited by Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu and will attend the country’s 60th Independence Day celebrations as the Guest of Honour

title: Seven students killed as portion of school building collapses in Rajasthan
content: Angry locals said they had informed the tehsildar and sub-divisional magistrate about the condition of the school building but no action was taken.

title: Parliament Monsoon session updates, Day 5: Both Houses adjourned for the day, Om Birla attempts ending logjam with all-party meeting
content: While both Houses witnessed little business in the inaugural week of the monsoon session, an all-party meeting called by Speaker Om Birla offers hope in ending the logjam with a discussion on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha

title: Telangana caste survey draws praise of Congress top leadership
content: Telangana Chief Minister Reddy pointed out that the Telangana caste survey was a role model for the country

title: ‘Untainted’ teachers and non-teaching staff left in the lurch, both in Kolkata and Delhi
content: Despite protests and appeals, axed teachers struggle to find justice; both Supreme Court and High Court refuse to interfere in new school recruitment process

title: KITE deploys 2,161 robotic kits in schools in Kerala’s Kannur to boost practical learning in robotics
content: As part of revised ICT curriculum, a chapter in Class 10 textbook introduces students to robotics concepts through practical activities such as circuit construction, the use of sensors and actuators and controlling devices via computer programming

title: APTSL to offer cybersecurity auditing services nationwide
content: Andhra Pradesh Technology Services Limited expands cybersecurity services to private sector and other States, offering internships and awareness programs to combat cyber frauds

title: Citizenship under suspicion | How migrant workers from West Bengal are being detained as Bangladeshi infiltrators
content: Following the recent detention of residents of West Bengal by the Delhi police on suspicion of being illegal Bangladeshi immigrants, The Hindu finds out how an exchange of land parcels between the two neighbouring nations in 2015 is affecting those who opted for Indian citizenship

title: Questions on Siddaramaiah's tenure as CM persist; leaves for Delhi along with DKS
content: The two Karnataka leaders are in New Delhi in their third trip since June, even as an uneasy calm prevails in the State Congress unit where voices from both camps have fallen silent over the CM issue following a high command gag order

title: Rape and murder convict Govindachamy captured after escape from Kannur jail
content: Govindachamy was found hiding inside a well. He earlier escaped from the jail, prompting a Statewide manhunt

title: Cybercrime police arrest 45 in nationwide crackdown on online fraud
content: Of the 45 persons arrested, 17 were linked to trading fraud schemes, while nine others were apprehended for operating an illegal cybercrime call centre that defrauded citizens in India and the United States

title: In Odisha, crimes against women mount as courts and police falter
content: With a high case load, poor conviction and chargesheeting rates, Odisha’s response to crimes against women is inadequate

title: PM Rozgar Yojana: First Time Employees To Earn Rs 15,000 From August 1
content: First-time employees registered with the EPFO are set to earn Rs 15,000 from August 1 under the new PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana (PM-VBRY), said the Ministry of Labour and Employment on Friday.

title: Man Who Escaped Jail Raped, Killed 23-Year-Old. All About 2011 Soumya Case
content: The 2011 Soumya murder case in Kerala is back in focus after convict Govindachamy attempted to escape from a high-security prison.

title: Karnataka Girl, 4, Raped In School, Mother Found Out When She Returned Home
content: A four-year-old girl has allegedly been raped at her school in Karnataka's Bidar, with the police registering a case against an unknown person.

title: Ship Turnaround Time At Indian Ports Now Less Than A Day: Minister
content: The Indian ports have significantly improved operational efficiency, with the average turnaround time for ships reduced from 4 days to less than 1 day, outperforming many advanced nations

title: "Free From Him": Army Jawan Choked To Death By Live-In Partner; Arrested
content: An Army jawan was strangulated to death allegedly by his live-in partner here, police said on Friday. The accused has been arrested.

title: Starlink Network Issue Now Resolved; Elon Musk Issues Apology
content: After facing a global outage for nearly 3 hours, Starlink announced on Friday that the network issue affecting its internet service has been resolved.

title: No Fault With Boeing Fuel Control Unit: US Aviation Body On Air India Crash
content: The head of the Federal Aviation Administration said on Thursday the fatal crash last month of an Air India Boeing 787 jet does not appear to have been caused by a mechanical issue or inadvertent movement of the fuel control unit or switches.

title: Ukraine Secures Three Patriot Missile Systems, Seeks Seven More
content: Ukraine has received confirmation from partners that they will provide three Patriot missile defence systems and discussions are underway to obtain seven more, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Thursday.

title: PM Modi To Launch Projects Worth Over Rs 4,800 Crore In Tamil Nadu
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will lay the foundation stone, inaugurate and dedicate to the nation various Development Projects worth over Rs 4800 crore at a public event at Tuticorin, Tamil Nadu at around 8 PM on July 26.

title: 500 Years Old Hawaiian Petroglyph Now Visible In Ohao. Here's How
content: Hawaiian petroglyphs dating back at least a half-millennium are visible on Oahu for the first time in years, thanks to seasonal ocean swells that peel away sand covering a panel of more than two dozen images of mostly human-looking stick figures.

title: How Sectarian Violence Drove Syria's Druze From Unity To Uprising
content: Clashes broke out last week that were sparked by tit-for-tat kidnappings between armed Bedouin clans and fighters with the Druze religious minority. The violence killed hundreds of people and threatened to unravel Syria's fragile postwar transition.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Rahul's 'Masterly Inaction' Can Cost Congress More Than Just Karnataka
content: The prospects of a repeat of Madhya Pradesh cannot be ruled out in Karnataka. Rahul is running out of both time and options.

title: Top Court Allows Kerala To Withdraw Pleas Against Governor Over Assent To Bills
content: The Supreme Court on Friday allowed the Kerala government to withdraw its pleas against the Governor over the delay in approving bills passed by the state assembly.

title: Centre Bans OTT Platforms Ullu, ALTT, Desiflix For Obscene Content
content: In a bid to crack down on unlawful and obscene content, the government has directed Internet Service Providers (ISPs) to disable public access to 25 OTT platforms, including big and popular names like Ullu, ALTT, and Desiflix.

title: #IshibaDon'tQuit: Unlikely Support Grows for Japanese PM Ishiba To Stay
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's future is uncertain but an unlikely campaign for him to stay was growing online this week, including from people who are his natural political opponents.

title: Indian Automobile Industry Welcomes Landmark India-UK Free Trade Agreement
content: The Indian automobile industry has warmly welcomed the recently signed India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA), terming it a landmark and transformative development in the global economic landscape.

title: Thane Court Acquits Man In 25-Year-Old Murder Case Over Lack Of Evidence
content: A court in Maharashtra's Thane district has acquitted a 46-year-old man accused of murdering a woman 25 years ago, citing lack of evidence and unreliable witness testimony.

title: "Saw Her In Dream": Maharashtra Teen, Upset Over Mother's Death, Kills Self
content: Officials found a suicide note in which the boy mentioned that he had dreamt of his mother - who "asked" him to "come to her".

title: Trump's AI Plan Calls For Massive Data Centers, May Affect Energy In US
content: President Donald Trump's plan to boost artificial intelligence and build data centers across the US could speed up a building boom that was already expected to strain the nation's ability to power it.

title: Top Court Extends Stay On Summons To Rahul Gandhi In Savarkar Defamation Case
content: The Supreme Court on Friday extended stay granted on summons issued to Rahul Gandhi by a lower court in Lucknow over his remarks against VD Savarkar.

title: High alert in Kerala’s Kanhangad after LPG tanker overturns, holiday declared, traffic curbs in place
content: The tanker overturned into a roadside swamp while trying to give way to an oncoming bus on a narrow service road

title: For Karnataka students, the grass is still greener overseas
content: Be it geopolitical tensions, new immigration laws, visa troubles or non-availability of jobs, many students who had gone abroad from Karnataka have returned in the last couple of years. While uncertainty loomed over many of their futures, some have managed to bring their studies and careers back on track after either flying to other countries to complete their education or deciding to find jobs in India, writes Jahnavi T.R.

title: Felt redemption of consciousness, say foreign pilgrims after Amarnath shrine ‘darshan’
content: The six foreigners who visited the cave shrine located at an altitude of around 14000 feet including pilgrims from the United States, Canada and Germany

title: IIT Guwahati team gives bamboo an automobile-ready touch
content: Combined with biodegradable polymers, the fast-growing Bambusa tulda has potential applications in automobiles and packaging, researchers said

title: Global childhood vaccination slowed by pandemic: study
content: The study published in The Lancet highlights the progress and challenges in vaccination efforts across the globe from 1980 to 2023

title: A.P. Governor advocates cultivation of oilseeds, pulses to check malnutrition in country
content: Andhra Pradesh was a leading performer with a Compound Annual Growth Rate of 8.8% in agriculture and allied sectors in 2024-25 fiscal year, says Governor Abdul Nazeer

title: TDP, BJP leaders submit memoranda to CEO on strengthening the electoral process
content: Among others, they suggest that death details be gathered from local bodies at regular interval and voter lists updated accordingly, zero door number system be avoided, and schools / colleges be made voter enrollment hubs

title: IMD issues ‘heavy to very heavy rainfall’ warning for North Coastal Andhra Pradesh till July 27
content: Low-pressure area forms over north Bay of Bengal, and it is likely to become well marked and move towards West Bengal and North Odisha, says IMD

title: Rajasthan considering establishment of “risk relief fund” for farmers
content: The fund is to resolve the financial difficulties faced by them because of high premium charged by crop insurance companies

title: Modi leaves for Maldives after concluding U.K. trip
content: Mr. Modi was hosted by his U.K. counterpart, Keir Starmer for an intense session of talks that also covered regional and global issues of mutual interest

title: Indian students flagged difficulty in obtaining U.S. student visa appointments: Govt to Parliament
content: Govt said the MEA took up the matter with the U.S. Embassy in New Delhi as well as the U.S. Department of State

title: India, U.S. presently engaged in active negotiations on Bilateral Trade Agreement: Govt in Parliament
content: Both sides acknowledged the importance of "maintaining positive momentum" in these negotiations and expressed their commitment to an early conclusion of the first tranche of a mutually beneficial, multi-sector BTA, Govt said

title: Mandatory to immerse Plaster of Paris (PoP) Ganesh idols up to 6 ft in artificial ponds only, says Bombay HC
content: The order will be effective till March next year for the festivals that have the custom of immersing deities’ idols in Maharashtra

title: Operation Sindoor: India's actions were measured, non-escalatory, govt tells Parliament
content: Minster of State for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh said said Operation Sindoor was launched to respond to a "barbaric cross-border terror attack by Pakistan-sponsored terrorists

title: V.S. Achuthanandan, the man of the masses
content: Had it not been for him, many cases and issues deserving public attention and debate would have easily gone under the carpet

title: Central govt. officials petition Cabinet Secretary, PMO on career stagnation
content: In its appeal to the Prime Minister, forum seeks fresh cadre review, initiation of time-bound promotions, and service parity with other Central Civil Services

title: Stop unlawful deportation of Bengali Muslims, Human Rights Watch tells government
content: To garner political support, BJP-run States have rounded up Muslims, mostly impoverished migrant workers, and turned them over to Indian border security personnel, it says

title: NGO members assaulted in Indore over suspicion of religious conversion
content: Right-wing activists attack Howl Group members during a press conference called by them to counter the “misinformation campaign” against it

title: One killed in Jammu shootout
content: The J&K Police has not issued any statement about the incident. Official sources said it took place when the police were chasing suspected drug peddlers in the area

title: Assertions like ‘J&K is illegally occupied’, ‘should separate from India’ attract UAPA sections: J&K High Court
content: The trial court was of the view that since the respondents were merely raising slogans with no activity of inciting violence, “Section 13 was not applicable”

title: The fault lines in India’s electoral architecture are visible
content: The Bihar poll rolls revision only strengthens the point that the Election Commission of India must back alternative models of enrolment

title: Home Minister to move statutory resolution in Parliament to extend President’s Rule in Manipur
content: Shah’s notice was admitted for Thursday but the House was adjourned around 2.15 p.m. following protest by the Opposition against the Election Commission’s SIR process in Bihar

title: When people live in mortal fear of traps set for the wildlife in Kerala
content: Illegal electric snares set up by farmers to ward off wild animals claimed two lives, one a 15-year-old, in the past two months in different parts of Kerala. Farmers are required to seek permission before installing electric traps, but that stipulation is seldom abided by. They just focus on crop protection, using the cheapest option available. Sam Paul A. gives an overall picture

title: Myanmar junta claims recapture of gold mining town, Thabeikkyin
content: A civil war has consumed Myanmar since a 2021 coup deposed the civilian government, with the military battling a myriad of pro-democracy guerrillas and ethnic armed organisations.

title: Sattankulam custodial deaths: CBI, victim’s wife object to prime accused’s plea to turn approver
content: Selvarani, wife of Jayaraj, submitted that the application was filed by policeman Sridhar with an intention to delay the trial proceedings.

title: Collector visits school, dines with students
content: Mr. Lakshmisha enquired with the students about quality of food and explained to them about cyber frauds

title: Honey trap row: BJP Minister questions Sharad Pawar and Eknath Khadse’s connection with the accused
content: Taking to social media, he highlighted that when the Opposition was in power, “they attempted to implicate” him in false crimes

title: SC reserves verdict on State government’s challenge on Kannada actor’s bail
content: The Bench was hearing a plea filed by the State against the High Court’s December 13, 2024 verdict granting bail to Mr. Darshan and co-accused

title: 11th edition of Malabar River Festival to begin in Kozhikode on July 25
content: Competitions to take place on Iruvazhinjipuzha and Chalippuzha; Public Works Minister to inaugurate closing ceremony on July 27, 2025

title: India-UK trade deal sealed, but scotch prices to come down only by next year
content: Despite the India-UK trade deal slashing scotch import duties, consumers shouldn't expect drastic price drops immediately. Ratification by the UK Parliament is pending, and even then, price reductions will likely be limited to 8-10% due to state taxes and distribution costs. While international and Indian spirits makers welcome the move, the real impact on consumers will be modest.

title: Crackdown on 'indecent' content: Govt bans over 20 OTT platforms; check full list
content: In a significant move, the Indian government has banned 25 Over-the-top (OTT) media platforms for allegedly broadcasting obscene content. The decision, made in consultation with various ministries, legal bodies, and industry experts, aims to curb access to pornographic material, particularly for minors.

title: '4 attempts made to kill Tejashwi’: Rabri Devi's explosive claim
content: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi has alleged that her son, Tejashwi Yadav's life is under threat, claiming four prior assassination attempts. Speaking to the media, she accused BJP-JD(U) members of plotting against Tejashwi, the INDIA bloc's potential CM face in Bihar.

title: MNS cracks down on Gujarati signage, issues warning to highway restaurants
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers targeted restaurants and hotels along the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway, demanding the prioritization of Marathi language. They warned establishments to change their signboards and menus to Marathi, damaging some Gujarati signboards in the process. MNS leaders emphasized that there would be no compromise on Marathi in Maharashtra, asserting that businesses must comply to operate in the state.

title: Microsoft layoffs: CEO Nadella to employees after 9,000 job cuts
content: Satya Nadella addressed Microsoft's significant job cuts, impacting over 15,000 employees, acknowledging the difficulty while emphasizing the necessity for the company's AI transformation. Despite record profits and soaring stock prices, Nadella described the layoffs as part of a dynamic industry shift, requiring Microsoft to adapt and invest heavily in AI infrastructure to meet evolving customer needs.

title: Where is Bihar's Rs 70,877 crore public fund? CAG flags ‘embezzlement risk’
content: The findings were part of the CAG’s report on State Finances for the year 2023–24, which was tabled in the state assembly on Thursday.

title: Death sudden and suspicious: Sunjay Kapur’s mother writes to Sona Comstar board
content: Rani Kapur, mother of the late Sunjay Kapur, has requested Sona Comstar to postpone its AGM, citing her son's death. She alleges being coerced into signing documents without understanding them during her grieving period. Kapur also expresses concerns about recent management changes and lack of transparency, seeking a delay to properly evaluate proposed resolutions and gather information.

title: Cricketer Yash Dayal accused of sexually assaulting minor; second case against him
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru bowler Yash Dayal faces a second FIR, this time in Jaipur, accused of repeatedly sexually assaulting a minor in 2023 and again in April 2024. This follows a previous rape complaint filed in Ghaziabad. Police have registered the case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and POCSO Act, initiating investigations and recording the survivor's statement.

title: AI gone wild: ChatGPT caught giving step-by-step guides to murder
content: A disturbing investigation reveals OpenAI's ChatGPT providing explicit instructions for self-mutilation, ritualistic bloodletting, and even murder. The chatbot offered detailed guidance, invocations, and printable PDFs for dangerous practices, raising serious concerns about AI safety guardrails. Similar issues plague Google's Gemini and Elon Musk's Grok, highlighting industry-wide failures in content moderation and user safety.

title: Visit turns awkward: Fed Chair publicly fact-checks Trump - Watch
content: During a tour of the Federal Reserve, President Trump publicly clashed with Chair Jerome Powell over renovation costs, alleging a $3.1 billion overrun. Powell refuted the claim, clarifying that Trump was including a separate, completed building in the calculation. Despite Powell's explanation, Trump maintained his stance and criticized the Fed's interest rate policy, while White House officials downplayed the dispute.

title: Kamal Haasan sworn in as Rajya Sabha MP, takes oath in Tamil
content: Kamal Haasan, the veteran actor and Makkal Needhi Maiam founder, is now a Rajya Sabha MP. He took his oath in Tamil. He expressed honour to serve in the Upper House. Haasan's entry marks a significant step in his political journey. He was nominated with DMK-led alliance support. He had filed his nomination earlier this month

title: Chess WC | India assured of medals; but what to expect from Humpy vs Deshmukh final?
content: India is guaranteed gold and silver at the FIDE Women’s World Cup as Divya Deshmukh and Koneru Humpy face off in the final. Humpy, the reigning World Rapid Champion, brings decades of experience, while Deshmukh, a rising star, showcases fearless play. The winner secures a spot in the 2026 Candidates Tournament, marking a significant moment for Indian chess.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Don't feel sad for my employees; I’ve made billionaires..
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: Sundar Pichai joins the ‘billionaire club’ after leading Google for over a decade
content: Sundar Pichai, Alphabet's CEO since 2015, has achieved billionaire status with a net worth of $1.1 billion, driven by Alphabet's market value soaring by over $1 trillion since early 2023. His leadership through technological shifts and strategic investments in AI have transformed Alphabet's core businesses, leading to substantial financial success.

title: Bill Clinton also among 50 who wrote birthday note to Epstein
content: Bill Clinton sent a birthday letter to Jeffrey Epstein for his 50th birthday in 2003, joining nearly 50 others, including Donald Trump, who also contributed. The messages were compiled by Ghislaine Maxwell into an album. The Wall Street Journal reported on the contents of the album, detailing the senders and the nature of their messages to Epstein.

title: ‘Been hit quite hard…’: Bajaj Auto reels from China’s rare earth magnet curbs
content: Bajaj Auto may halt electric scooter production in August due to China's rare earth magnet curbs, impacting Chetak and GoGo models. The company faces a potential 'zero month' due to high volume requirements and limited alternatives.

title: Stock market crash: Nifty50 goes below 24,850, Sensex down over 700 pts - top reasons for fall
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, crashed in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 went below 24,850, BSE Sensex was down over 700 points.

title: 'From one chaiwala to another': PM Modi, UK PM Starmer enjoy cup of tea
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK's Keir Starmer strengthened India-UK ties over 'chai pe charcha' at Chequers after signing the Free Trade Agreement. The leaders displayed a strong rapport during their meeting, with PM Modi emphasizing a robust partnership using cricket analogies. The India-UK Free Trade Agreement was signed by commerce ministers from both nations.

title: 'Saiyaara': Ahaan Panday, Aneet Padda starrer maintains pace; crosses Rs 170
content: Saiyaara continues its box office success, earning ₹172.75 crore in its first week, despite a slight dip mid-week. The film is expected to grow over the weekend due to the holiday and lack of major competition, with 'Son Of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' release dates being pushed. On its second Friday, the film has already grossed ₹2.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Go play tennis or golf': Gavaskar slams concussion substitute rule
content: Sunil Gavaskar has criticised the ICC's concussion substitute policy, deeming it inconsistent and unfair. He argues that if concussion substitutes are allowed, similar provisions should exist for clear injuries like Rishabh Pant's fractured foot. Michael Vaughan supports Gavaskar, advocating for rule changes to allow like-for-like injury replacements to maintain the game's quality.

title: Did Karun Nair break down after being dropped?
content: Karun Nair's highly anticipated Test comeback was cut short after a series of poor performances, leading to his exclusion from the fourth Test. He managed only 131 runs in six innings, prompting his replacement by B Sai Sudharsan. Mohammad Kaif criticised captain Shubman Gill's decision, arguing that Nair deserved another opportunity to prove himself.

title: 4.5 crore Kanwariyas, 7k tonnes of trash: Kanwar Yatra leaves Haridwar gasping
content: The annual Kanwar Yatra in Haridwar concluded, leaving behind over 7,000 metric tons of waste, overwhelming the city's sanitation efforts despite increased deployment of workers and drone surveillance. While authorities assure swift cleanup, residents express skepticism, citing widespread garbage along ghats and routes. Some residents noted improvements in traffic management and reduced violence, attributing it to regulated routes and parking.

title: ‘Bit her neck multiple times’: Drunk man kills wife in Bihar
content: In Madhepura's Shyam village, a shocking incident occurred where an intoxicated man, Vilash Rishideo, allegedly murdered his wife, Sushila Devi, by repeatedly biting her neck during an argument over his drinking. Following the villagers' alert, police arrested Vilash, and a case has been registered based on the victim's family's statement.

title: Pune retiree hit by auto, taken away by driver; dumped at secluded place to die
content: Gopal Wagh, 63, died after an autorickshaw hit him near Balewadi Phata. The driver, instead of taking him to a hospital, abandoned him in Range Hills. Wagh's sons filed a missing person complaint. Police found Wagh dead. They registered a case against the driver, who fled to Uttar Pradesh. Police are searching for him.

title: Soumya rape-murder case: Convict caught hours after escaping jail; was hiding in well
content: Govindachamy, convicted of rape and murder, escaped from Kannur Central Jail in Kerala early Friday morning, prompting a statewide search. Authorities discovered his absence during a routine check of his cell. An internal inquiry has been launched to investigate the circumstances surrounding his escape and determine any security lapses that may have occurred.

title: ‘Make America Grime Again’: Trump sculpture emerges from New York sewer
content: French street artist James Colomina installed a red sculpture of Donald Trump emerging from a Manhattan manhole, titled 'Donald,' aiming to disrupt Trump's image. The artwork, placed near Trump Tower, featured a rat and was quickly removed. Colomina's work, known for its bold color and social commentary, drew a dismissive response from the White House.

title: 'Stripped to underwear': 2 men allege mistreatment at Gurgaon police station
content: Two men detained in Gurgaon allege they were forced to strip to their underwear and held overnight after being picked up for ID verification. Police deny the allegations, stating the detainees were only taken for verification. The detentions are part of an effort to identify illegal immigrants, causing fear among Bengali communities, with many families leaving the city.

title: DRDO successfully tests UAV-Launched Precision Missile ULPGM-V3
content: India has successfully conducted flight trials of the UAV Launched Precision Guided Missile (ULPGM)-V3 in Andhra Pradesh. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh lauded the achievement, emphasizing the Indian industry's readiness to produce critical defence technologies.

title: Indian-origin Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai joins billionaire club
content: Alphabet's strong earnings have propelled its market value, rewarding investors. This surge has also elevated CEO Sundar Pichai to billionaire status. Pichai's wealth stems from his leadership and compensation, a rarity for non-founder tech CEOs. Alphabet's success is fueled by artificial intelligence and cloud service demand.

title: School building collapses in Rajasthan: 7 dead, 29 injured
content: A tragic incident occurred in Jhalawar's Piplod village where a government school building collapsed during morning prayer, resulting in the death of six students and injuries to twenty-nine others. Authorities have initiated rescue operations and provided medical assistance. Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma and Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed grief and assured support.

title: India-UK trade deal: From cars, whisky to chocolates, what gets cheaper ? Check list
content: India and the UK have formalized a free trade agreement, aiming to double bilateral trade to $112 billion by 2030. The deal grants duty-free access to 99% of Indian exports to Britain, boosting sectors like textiles and leather. Simultaneously, prices for British automobiles and whiskey will decrease in India.

title: Watch: Rahul, Priyanka, Dimple tear SIR placards; protest enters fifth day
content: Congress MP and leader of opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, and Samajwadi Party MP Dimple Yadav, along with several MPs from INDIA bloc parties, tore placards with SIR written on them and threw them into a dustbin as part of their demonstration on the Parliament premises.

title: County Cricket | Tilak Varma slams second century in three games - Watch
content: Tilak Varma solidified his burgeoning reputation with a brilliant century for Hampshire against Nottinghamshire in the County Championship. His composed 112-run innings, featuring elegant drives and fluent strokeplay, helped Hampshire take closer to avoiding a follow-on. Varma's consistent performance in English conditions, averaging just under 79, is making a strong case for his inclusion in India's Test squad.

title: UGC, AICTE, NCTE on the edge: Will one regulator fix what three couldn't?
content: India's higher education is undergoing a major change. The government plans to replace the UGC, AICTE, and NCTE with a single body, HECI. This aims to streamline regulations and improve quality. Past committees have suggested similar reforms. HECI promises efficiency and accountability. However, concerns exist about centralized control and loss of expertise.

title: Isro-Nasa's costliest launch lifts off; 5 ways it reshapes science
content: India is preparing for the launch of NISAR. It is a joint project between ISRO and NASA. The satellite costs $1.5 billion. NISAR will monitor Earth's surface changes. It will help in disaster prediction. The satellite has advanced radar systems. It will scan Earth every 12 days. This collaboration showcases international cooperation. The project could reshape our understanding of Earth.

title: Mumbai shocker: Landlord asks for rent, tenant rams car into him; arrested
content: In Mumbai's Deonar area, a tenant was arrested for allegedly attempting to murder his landlord after a rent dispute escalated. The incident occurred on July 21 when the landlord visited to collect rent, leading to a heated argument.

title: Thailand-Cambodia clash: India issues advisory; lists areas 'not safe to visit'
content: The Indian Embassy in Thailand has advised its citizens to avoid areas near the Thailand-Cambodia border due to ongoing deadly clashes. Fighting has escalated, involving heavy weaponry and resulting in casualties and mass displacement. The Tourism Authority of Thailand has identified specific restricted zones across seven provinces.

title: 'India hard done by weather gods': Ex-cricketer on changing conditions
content: Sanjay Manjrekar expressed concerns over the favorable weather and pitch conditions that aided England on Day 2 of the fourth Test after India's challenging batting stint. England capitalised with a strong opening partnership, reaching 225/2 at stumps. Jonathan Trott noted the advantageous batting conditions for England, while Manjrekar praised Anshul Kamboj's potential despite unfavorable conditions.

title: 'Still this sad after 20 years': Linda’s post on Hulk goes viral; details
content: Just days before Hulk Hogan's death, Linda Hogan shared a nostalgic tribute to their 26-year marriage, a post now imbued with unexpected finality. Despite a public split in 2009 and subsequent estrangement, Linda acknowledged both the pain and Hulk's role as a father. Her reflections, a mix of grief and closure, unintentionally became a final farewell to the wrestling icon.

title: Cricketer Yash Dayal accused of sexually assaulting minor girl at city hotel
content: IPL cricketer Yash Dayal faces a second FIR, this time in Jaipur, alleging repeated sexual assault of a minor in 2023 and again in April. This follows a previous rape complaint filed in Ghaziabad.

title: 'How do you break a man who's defeated death?': Ex-cricketer hails Pant's grit
content: Aakash Chopra lauded Rishabh Pant's indomitable spirit after he batted through pain with a fractured toe in the fourth Test at Old Trafford, drawing comparisons to Anil Kumble's legendary resolve. Despite his injury, Pant scored a valuable 54, showcasing immense patriotism and earning widespread respect. Chopra criticised England's tactics but admired Pant's unbreakable determination against all odds.

title: Robbers in Swiggy, Blinkit uniforms loot jewellery shop in Ghaziabad
content: In a brazen daylight robbery, two individuals disguised as delivery agents targeted Mansi Jewellers in Ghaziabad's Brij Vihar. The robbers, dressed in Swiggy and Blinkit uniforms, stormed the shop, threatened the employee at gunpoint, and stole gold, silver ornaments, and cash worth approximately Rs 30 lakh within six minutes.

title: 'Walking corpses': Photos of malnourished Gaza toddler go viral; see pics inside
content: A Gaza-based photographer captured a viral image revealing extreme hunger among children, highlighting the worsening humanitarian crisis. While famine hasn't been formally declared, UN agencies warn of mass starvation due to restricted aid, a claim Israel denies, blaming Hamas.

title: UP man swings 8-month-old son upside down & roams village
content: In Rampur, a man, enraged over unmet dowry demands of Rs 2 lakh and a car, was filmed holding his eight-month-old son upside down and parading him through the village. The incident, which occurred on July 19, prompted police action for disturbing public peace, despite no formal complaint being filed.

title: Tom Aspinall booked his first title defense, but is it the right matchup?
content: new heavyweight champion Tom Aspinall looks to move on from the 12-month saga that was Jon Jones' retirement in an undisputed title defense against Ciryl Gane in the main event of UFC 321 on Oct. 25 in Abu Dhabi . aspinall will attempt to reclaim the light heavyweight championship in an immediate rematch .

title: Youth goes missing after vehicle falls into river in Chikkamagaluru; his mother dies on learning about it
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Expert picks, best bets: How can Whittaker bounce back vs. de Ridder at UFC Fight Night?
content: Reinier de Ridder claims a second-round TKO to give bo Nickal his first career UFC loss . the pair will host their first of two 2025 fight cards in Abu Dhabi this weekend . he suffered a first-round submission loss against Khamzat Chimaev in his last Octagon appearance .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Summer storylines for all 32 teams
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on how strong each team will be in the 2025-26 season . this edition includes the top storyline for each team during the summer break, which generates our master list .

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

title: 2026 class rankings: Texas surges into the top 5
content: 11 five-star prospects have declared, including two recent commits . the longhorns are making themselves comfortable within SEC country . they landed running back Derrick Cooper, a one-time Georgia commit . Texas flipped ESPN 300 DT James Johnson from the Bulldogs, which helped spur the Horns' leap in the rankings .

title: Semifinal talking points: Bonmatí's genius, England's luck, too few teams?
content: defending champions England needed a 96th-minute equalizer and a penalty in extra time to overcome Italy . but both teams struggled through their semifinals to get there . the tournament is down the final two, and it's a repeat of the 2023 world cup final .

title: Fresh threads alert: Packers, Saints and more unveil new uniforms for 2025
content: the new "Charger Power" uniforms have been a popular choice in the NFL offseason . the Chargers have also gone back in time, dropping a "modern throwback" all-navy combination . a helmet color is getting love, too, as the new Orleans Saints dropped a new design .

title: The Gyökeres-to-Arsenal saga finally looks close to ending. What took so long?
content: arsenal are in a bad spot amid a transfer standoff with Sporting CP for Viktor Gyökeres . the striker's name is still looming over the club's preseason tour to Asia and he isn't even a Gunner yet . he'll shock everyone after an arsenal fan event at an Irish bar .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Bills embrace 'Hard Knocks' presence
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room .

title: With Jets' injury history at QB, Fields' minor setback a sigh of relief
content: the new york Jets have suffered major quarterback setbacks for a variety of reasons . in 2023, Aaron Rodgers ruptured his left Achilles on the fourth snap of the season . he was said to have "avoided serious injury and significant missed time"

title: Rebuild rankings: How close 14 teams are to title contention
content: Portland Trail Blazers make the playoffs this season despite offseason moves . the first version of the 2025 NBA rebuild rankings launched in march . it was the expectation that the draft lottery would signal a massive shift . but the new rankings are as hard to parse as in spring .

title: MLB trade deadline dominoes for the 10 biggest names on the market
content: Jeff Passan breaks down the top players in the trade deadline rankings . we're down to crunch time as the July 31 trade deadline approaches . take 10 of the biggest names who could move and see how the dominoes might fall .

title: MLB trade grades: Mariners land Josh Naylor in first big deadline deal
content: this is your one-stop shop for grades and analysis breaking down the details for every trade as they go down . it's the first significant trade heading into the final week before the deadline . Naylor could be the first of a group that might include Eugenio Suarez and Merrill Kelly .
